title: 3D City-Building Simulation
long_description: This project involved the complete design and development of 'Society's Edge,' a 3D city-building and resource management game. Built in C# using the Unity 3D engine, the primary objective was to engineer a feature-rich simulation that blends the complex logistical management of factory-builders with the dynamic NPC simulation and survival aspects of city-builders.

The core gameplay loop centers on strategic expansion and management. Players develop a city on a procedurally generated 64x64 grid, contending with three distinct biomes (Fire, Wind, Earth) that provide buffs or debuffs to buildings. They must manage a 12-item resource economy, advance through a 3-tier research tree to unlock new technology, and support a population of autonomous NPCs who dynamically seek out homes and jobs.

The game is supported by a robust, custom-built backend using a MySQL database hosted on Amazon Web Services (AWS). This scalable infrastructure handles secure user authentication, persistent cloud saving, and all player data. The project was a successful integration of complex frontend gameplay logic with a secure, high-performance backend, demonstrating advanced problem-solving in areas of AI, database architecture, and performance optimization.

gallery.caption: Strategic, Grid-Based City Building.
gallery.description: The game's front-end is built around a complex grid-based building and resource system. A core mechanic is the procedural world generation, which creates maps with strategic biomes that directly impact building efficiency, forcing the player to make tactical placement decisions. The economy is driven by 12 distinct resources, which are either gathered by basic buildings or crafted by advanced 'Producer' buildings. Player progression is managed via a 3-tier research tree, and a comprehensive UI system—including a top-level info bar and a detailed 'City Overview' menu—was built to give the player full managerial control over their expanding city.

gallery.caption: Optimized A* Pathfinding & AI Simulation.
gallery.description: A primary technical challenge was engineering the autonomous NPC simulation. The A* pathfinding algorithm was implemented from scratch to manage all NPC movement, using a custom-built PriorityQueue data structure to efficiently sort nodes. To handle the computational load of many NPCs, a path caching system was designed using a hash map (`LinkedList[]`). This system stores and retrieves previously calculated paths, skipping the A* calculation entirely. This, combined with a 'soft reset' function that eliminated massive garbage collection spikes, resulted in a high-performance simulation capable of scaling as the city grows.

gallery.caption: Secure Backend & Database Architecture.
gallery.description: To support cloud saving and user accounts, a secure backend was custom-built using a MySQL database on AWS. A normalized, relational schema was designed to store all game data, serializing the complete game state into BLOBs within a `Files` table linked to each user's save. Security was paramount: a unique, multi-stage hashing algorithm was developed that hashes a user's password and then hashes that result again against a random, per-user salt. This method, combined with brute-force lockouts and strict password validation, ensures robust protection for user credentials.
